subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... JUnit failures occur when an instance of AssertionFailedException propogates out of a test case. JUnit errors occur when any other type of exception comes
messageBody:
> I think that JUnit wants by itself to differentiate
> between an ERROR and a FAILURE. My tests are failures, the
> configuration is.

JUnit failures occur when an instance of
AssertionFailedException propogates out of a test case.
JUnit errors occur when any other type of exception comes
out.

This means, for example, if you come in and see 100 failed
tests (instead of 1 failed test and 99 errored tests), that
you have tests with repeated assertions. One of the most
common of these would be assertNotNull() around things so as
to avoid NullPointerException _errors_.

Robert.
